steps.details: Deploy field engineers to operate signals in manual mode and stabilize phasing until repairs.
Technicians to cool the controller housing, inspect for faults and replace heat-damaged components.
Notify commuters of expected delays and recommend alternate routes during repair window.
Coordinate BMTC to adjust departure times to reduce peak pressure at the junction.
Log the incident and plan enhanced thermal monitoring for hot-spot controllers.
Deliver mobile UPS or standby generators to maintain critical signal and safety systems.
Technicians to test UPS health, battery status and replace depleted units.
Deploy crossing guards to manage pedestrian movements with dark pedestrian signals.
Assign additional staff at intersections with known high accident rates for added safety.
Publish expected restoration actions and timelines to stakeholders.
Trigger city-level incident management to marshal cross-agency resources for prolonged disruption.
Open contraflow lanes to bypass congested sections and relieve queue backpressure.
Move heavy freight vehicles out of mix zones to improve arterial capacity.
Push high-quality alternate routes to navigation partners and public portals.
Analyse root causes and hardware vulnerabilities to harden intersections against future systemic collapse.
